title: Ticket #1417: Create PASS/FAIL idiom in unit test suite
description:
In many places in the unit test suite, we see this: 

    e.emit_result_success(__LINE__);
    return true;

and 

    e.emit_result_failure(__LINE__);
    return false;

A problem (which has happened enough annoying times) is that people accidentally state a result success, but then return failure, or the other way around. This needs to be made less error prone.

I propose in emit.h, adding this code: 

#define FAIL \
  e.emit_result_failure(__LINE__); \
  return false

#define PASS \
  e.emit_result_success(__LINE__); \
  return true

So that the initial code can just be replaced with: 

    PASS;

and 

    FAIL;
